name: Julianna EIDEM v. WORKERS' COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (GNADEN-HUETTEN MEMORIAL HOSPITAL). Petition of Gnaden-Huetten Memorial Hospital and Phico Insurance Company
name_abbreviation: Eidem v. Workers' Compensation Appeal Board
docket_number: Petition No. 946 Middle District Allocatur Docket 1998

parties: Julianna EIDEM v. WORKERS’ COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (GNADEN-HUETTEN MEMORIAL HOSPITAL). Petition of Gnaden-Huetten Memorial Hospital and Phico Insurance Company.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 9’ day of June, 1999, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED and the parties are directed to brief the issue as follows:
Whether the Commonwealth Court erred in finding that the referral letter did not provide sufficient notice of a job position, where employee had previously been employed in that position, in order to satisfy employer’s burden of proof pursuant to Kachinski v. W.C.A.B. (Vepco Construction Co.), 516 Pa. 240, 532 A.2d 374 (1987).
The Petition for Supersedeas is DENIED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

casebody.head_matter:
731 A.2d 128
Julianna EIDEM v. WORKERS’ COMPENSATION APPEAL BOARD (GNADEN-HUETTEN MEMORIAL HOSPITAL). Petition of Gnaden-Huetten Memorial Hospital and Phico Insurance Company.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 9, 1999.
